verses.text: And the child Samuel ministered unto the \sc Lord\sc* before Eli. And the word of the \sc Lord\sc* was precious in those days; \add there was\add* no open vision.
And it came to pass at that time, when Eli \add was\add* laid down in his place, and his eyes began \add to wax\add* dim, \add that\add* he could not see;
and ere the lamp of God went out in the temple of the \sc Lord\sc*, where the ark of God \add was\add*, and Samuel was laid down \add to sleep;\add*
that the \sc Lord\sc* called Samuel: and he answered, Here \add am\add* I.
And he ran unto Eli, and said, Here \add am\add* I; for thou calledst me. And he said, I called not; lie down again. And he went and lay down.
And the \sc Lord\sc* called yet again, Samuel. And Samuel arose and went to Eli, and said, Here \add am\add* I; for thou didst call me. And he answered, I called not, my son; lie down again.
Now Samuel did not yet know the \sc Lord\sc*, neither was the word of the \sc Lord\sc* yet revealed unto him.

And the \sc Lord\sc* called Samuel again the third time. And he arose and went to Eli, and said, Here \add am\add* I; for thou didst call me. And Eli perceived that the \sc Lord\sc* had called the child.
Therefore Eli said unto Samuel, Go, lie down: and it shall be, if he call thee, that thou shalt say, Speak, \sc Lord\sc*; for thy servant heareth. So Samuel went and lay down in his place.
And the \sc Lord\sc* came, and stood, and called as at other times, Samuel, Samuel. Then Samuel answered, Speak; for thy servant heareth.
And the \sc Lord\sc* said to Samuel, Behold, I will do a thing in Israel, \add at\add* which both the ears of every one that heareth it shall tingle.
In that day I will perform against Eli all \add things\add* which I have spoken concerning his house: when I begin, I will also make an end.
For I have told him that I will judge his house for ever for the iniquity which he knoweth; because his sons made themselves vile, and he restrained them not.
And therefore I have sworn unto the house of Eli, that the iniquity of Eliâ€™s house shall not be purged with sacrifice nor offering for ever.
And Samuel lay until the morning, and opened the doors of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*. And Samuel feared to shew Eli the vision.
Then Eli called Samuel, and said, Samuel, my son. And he answered, Here \add am\add* I.

And he said, What \add is\add* the thing that \add the \+sc Lord\+sc*\add* hath said unto thee? I pray thee hide \add it\add* not from me: God do so to thee, and more also, if thou hide \add any\add* thing from me of all the things that he said unto thee.
And Samuel told him every whit, and hid nothing from him. And he said, It \add is\add* the \sc Lord\sc*: let him do what seemeth him good.
And Samuel grew, and the \sc Lord\sc* was with him, and did let none of his words fall to the ground.
And all Israel from Dan even to Beer-sheba knew that Samuel \add was\add* established to be a prophet of the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the \sc Lord\sc* appeared again in Shiloh: for the \sc Lord\sc* revealed himself to Samuel in Shiloh by the word of the \sc Lord\sc*.
